@@ -0,0 +1,42 @@
+import torch
+from torch.autograd import Variable
+
+
+def parameters_to_vector(parameters):
+    """Convert parameters to one vector
+
+    Arguments:
+        parameters (Iterable[Variable]): an iterator of Variables that are the
+            parameters of a model.
+
+    Returns:
+        The parameters represented by a single vector
+    """
+    vec = []
+    for param in parameters:
+        vec.append(param.view(-1))
body:
this will fail if the parameters are in multiple devices.
For example, will fail if:
- param1 is on CPU
- param2 is on GPU
Can happen if you put part of your model on CPU and other part on GPU

It will also fail if:
- param1 is on GPU0
- param2 is on GPU1

Can happen if you do model parallelism over GPUs.

So i think it's worth adding an additional check:
- errors out when it sees parameters are not on same devices
OR
- gets the first param, and records it's device / location
- then all subsequent parameters are moved onto that device

For now I think erroring out is safer.
